|signature = Nicolas Sarkozy signature.svg |website = [http://www.sarkozy.fr/
Official website] }} 'Nicolas Sarkozy' (; born 'Nicolas Paul
StÃ©phane SarkÃ¶zy de Nagy-Bocsa '; 28 January 1955) is a French
politician who served as the 23rd President of France from 16 May 2007 until
15 May 2012.

Before his presidency, he was the leader of the Union for a Popular Movement
(UMP). Under Jacques Chirac's presidency he served as Minister of the Interior
in Jean-Pierre Raffarin's (UMP) first two governments (from May 2002 to March
2004), then was appointed Minister of Finances in Raffarin's last government
(March 2004 to May 2005) and again Minister of the Interior in Dominique de
Villepin's government (2005â2007).

Sarkozy was also president of the General council of the Hauts-de-Seine
department from 2004 to 2007 and mayor of Neuilly-sur-Seine, one of the
wealthiest communes of France, from 1983 to 2002. He was Minister of
the Budget in the government of Ãdouard Balladur (RPR, predecessor of the UMP)
during FranÃ§ois Mitterrand's last term.

In foreign affairs, he promised a strengthening of the entente cordiale with the
United Kingdom  and closer cooperation with the United
States. Anderson, John Ward and Molly Moore; [http://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-
dyn/content/article/2007/05/06/AR2007050600216.html "Sarkozy Wins, Vows to
Restore Pride in France"], Washington Post, 7 May 2007 During his term, he
faced the late-2000s financial crisis (followed by the recession and the debt
crisis caused by it) and the Arab Spring (especially in Tunisia, Libya, and
Syria). He also married Italian-French singer-songwriter Carla Bruni on 2
February 2008 at the ÃlysÃ©e Palace in Paris.

On 6 May 2012, Sarkozy was defeated in the 2012 election by Socialist FranÃ§ois
Hollande by a margin of 3.2 percentage points, or 1,139,983 votes. â French
Ministry of the Interior. Hollande gathered 18,000,668 votes, while Sarkozy
obtained 16,860,685 votes. After leaving the office, Sarkozy retired from
political life. As a former president, Sarkozy is entitled to ex
officio membership in the Constitutional Council.
